results.title: For you madam. [No. 67/09] = Pour vous madame
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items including: 1. How to wallpaper your kitchen with adhesive paper. 2. An overview of the 25th International Leather Week Expo in Paris, including a fashion parade. 3. Francoise Chedeville, sculptor in ceramics, at work in her studio. 4. The performance of Mozart’s opera, Apollo and Hyacinth.

results.title: For you madam = Pour vous madame
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items: 1. Connaissance de la France - celebrates France’s 8th century first gothic building, Sants Cathedral, consecrated by Pope Alexander III in 1164. 2. In 1940, France’s National Geographical Institute set out to make a new map of the country, scheduled for completion in 1980. This segment focuses on the project’s progress. 3. Looks at an exhibition of masterpieces hosted by a French regional gallery which will eventually reach the Louvre. 4. ‘Foire de Paris = Paris Fair’ - presents some of the highlights. 5. Visits a bull-ring in Southern France which although controversial, attracts thousands of spectators. Shows the different stages of a bull-fight.

results.title: For whom the bell tolls
results.brief_description: A romantic drama set in 1937, during the Spanish Civil War. Gary Cooper plays Robert Jordan, an American who has joined a guerilla group and has been assigned to blow-up a Falangist controlled Bridge. He meets and falls in love with a young woman, played by Ingrid Bergman, who joined the group after her brutal treatment at the hands of the enemy. Written by Dudley Nichols, based on the novel by Ernest Hemingway, which was unanimously voted the best novel of the year in 1941 by the Pulitzer Prize committee, but was vetoed for political reasons. Cast also includes Akim Tamiroff, Arturo de Cordova and Katina Paxinou. Music by Victor Young. Photography by Ray Rennahan. Edited by Sherman Todd and John F. Link. (Awards: Katina Paxinou, Oscar 1943, Best Supporting Actress)

results.title: For Tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Norman Castle, Lilias Fraser, Conzinc Riotinto of Australia and Fraser Castle Productions
results.brief_description: Conzinc Riotinto sends geologists to Bougainville to search for minerals. The rugged mountainous jungle country, heat and humidity makes it an arduous task. They establish a drilling site where much sampling, testing and drilling of the area is carried out to evaluate the location.

results.title: For today, for tomorrow: new choices for older Australians
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Community Services and Health in association with National Recording Studios Canberra and Maria Taylor
results.brief_description: Through the lives of five older Australians, this program explores the Commonwealth Governments’ new directions for aged care services. The services featured include Home & Community Care services that allow people to remain in their own homes, the Geriatric Assessment Teams that assist individuals and their families in making informed choices and then co-ordinate the services, and a new range of choices for hostels and nursing homes. Discusses programs that address special needs such as those of older migrants. Narrated by June Salter.
